description: Domain Partitioning takes domain objects and partitions them into DDD structures (entities, value objects, aggregates, services, events, repositories, bounded contexts) following the definitions from slide 39.

do.description: Ask business questions to properly partition domain objects into DDD structures
do.content: For each DDD structure type (entities, value objects, aggregates, services, events, repositories, bounded contexts), ask the specific business questions provided in key_questions.json and use the answers to classify and organize domain objects

dont.description: Don't skip business questions or make technical assumptions without asking the business
dont.content: Skip asking business questions and assume technical answers, create generic CRUD repositories instead of asking business-specific questions, skip value objects without asking about immutability
